parameters.name: markSeen
parameters.label: Mark email message(s) as read when fetched

parameters.name: continueWhenNoRes
parameters.label: Continue the execution of the route even if the module finds no matches

parameters.name: ignoreInfiniteLoopsWhenGlobal
parameters.label: Ignore errors when there is an infinite search loop

variables.name: profile_context
variables.value:
CANDIDATE ROLE TARGET (CANONICAL — NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Primary Target: Tier-2 — Execution-First Systems Automation & Integration

Secondary Target (Add-on Only): Tier-2.5 — Bounded Logic & Data Ownership
Tier-2.5 roles are acceptable ONLY when clearly definition-owning and IC.

Tier classification is determined by the role’s primary center of responsibility, not by isolated tasks, keywords, or tooling mentioned.

NOT targeting Tier-1 software engineering, infrastructure, DevOps, or platform roles.

────────────────────────
TIER-2 ROLE IDENTITY (PRIMARY)

Execution-first technical implementer.

Receives clear inputs (tickets, specs, written requests).
Builds, wires, debugs, and hardens systems so they run reliably.

Core activities:
- iPaaS automation and integrations (Make, Zapier, n8n, Workato, Boomi, MuleSoft)
- Workflow configuration inside existing platforms (CRM, ERP, HRIS, RevOps)
- API implementation (consume existing APIs; no API product ownership)
- SQL for validation, reconciliation, diagnostics
- Light Python / JavaScript used ONLY as glue inside automation platforms

NOT responsible for:
- Defining business rules
- Owning metrics or data meaning
- Stakeholder facilitation
- Architecture or platform ownership
- Infrastructure, CI/CD, DevOps, or backend services

────────────────────────
TIER-2.5 ROLE IDENTITY (SECONDARY / SELECTIVE)

Bounded-domain logic, data, or rule authority (IC).

Core distinction:
Tier-2 implements rules.
Tier-2.5 decides what the rule should be within a defined domain.

Tier-2.5 roles:
- Define business rules, data definitions, or validation standards
- Own “what correct means” inside a bounded operational domain
- Arbitrate conflicts between systems or metrics
- May implement directly OR direct Tier-2 execution

Still NOT:
- People management
- Open-ended governance
- Workshops, facilitation, alignment theater
- Infrastructure or software engineering

────────────────────────
HARD EXCLUSIONS (ALWAYS CAP ≤5)

- Tier-1 SWE, backend, platform, DevOps, infrastructure
- Mainframe or OS-level roles (z/OS, MVS, COBOL, REXX, Assembler)
- CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, SRE
- Sales, presales, customer success
- PM, BA (facilitation-led), change management

variables.name: scoring_instructions
variables.value:
CANONICAL — TITLE-ONLY, PROBABILISTIC MODE:

You MUST follow this evaluation order exactly.

IMPORTANT CONTEXT

Job descriptions are NOT available.
Evaluation MUST be based only on the job title and real-world historical probability of that title mapping to a Tier-2 or Tier-2.5 role.

Do NOT infer responsibilities that are not statistically typical for the title.

STEP 1 — ROLE TYPE CLASSIFICATION (MANDATORY)

Classify the role FIRST using title-based probability, not assumed duties.

Choose ONE:

Tier-2 (execution-first automation / integration)

Tier-2.5 (bounded logic / data ownership IC)

Tier-1 (software engineering, infrastructure, DevOps, platform)

Below Target

Classification must reflect:

How this title is most commonly used in the job market

Not best-case or aspirational interpretations

If Tier-1 or Below Target → score MUST be ≤5.

STEP 2 — TITLE-LEVEL HARD DISQUALIFIER CHECK

If the job title itself strongly signals ANY of the following, the role is NOT Tier-2 or Tier-2.5:

Software Engineer, Backend Engineer, Platform Engineer

DevOps, SRE, Infrastructure Engineer

Data Engineer (non-integration), ML Engineer

Mainframe / z-OS / COBOL / Systems Programmer

Architect (Enterprise, Solutions, Platform)

Lead / Principal roles implying governance or ownership

Product Manager, Program Manager, Business Analyst (facilitation-led)

Sales, Presales, Solutions Consultant

If triggered → Tier-1 or Below Target → score ≤5.

STEP 3 — EXECUTION vs DEFINITION PROBABILITY TEST

Based on historical usage of this title, ask:

Does this title MOST OFTEN map to:

Execution-first implementation of pre-defined workflows? → Tier-2

Ownership of rules, definitions, or data meaning within a bounded domain? → Tier-2.5

If the title is commonly ambiguous or overloaded:

Apply an ambiguity penalty

Default downward, not upward

Never assume:

Clear specs exist

The role is hands-on

The role is IC
unless the title strongly implies it.

STEP 4 — SCORING (PROBABILITY-BASED)

Assign score using market-frequency likelihood, not hypothetical fit.

Guidelines:

High-frequency Tier-2 titles → higher scores

Mixed-use or overloaded titles → mid scores

Titles that frequently drift into BA, PM, or SWE → ≤5

Ambiguity ALWAYS lowers score.
Do NOT reward keyword similarity or aspirational interpretations.

SCORING CONSTRAINTS (STRICT)

Tier-2 roles may score 8–9

Tier-2.5 roles may score 6–7

Tier-1 roles MUST score ≤5

Below Target MUST score ≤5

Seniority words (Senior, Lead) do NOT increase score

Governance, ownership, or architecture implication lowers score

Never score ≥8 unless the title is a high-confidence Tier-2 signal

Score 10 is not permitted in title-only mode

OUTPUT JUSTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

primary_reasons MUST reference:

Title-level probability

Common real-world usage of the title

concerns MUST highlight:

Ambiguity

Common drift patterns for that title

If evidence is insufficient → explicitly state uncertainty

variables.name: scoring_rubric
variables.value:
TITLE-ONLY · PROBABILISTIC · LOCKED:

Scores reflect how often this job title maps to each tier in the real market, not how good the role could be.

Score 9 — Extremely High-Confidence Tier-2 (Apply)

Very rare in title-only mode

Title is strongly and consistently used for execution-first automation/integration.

Typical titles:

Workflow Automation Engineer

Integration Engineer (non-senior, non-architect)

Automation Engineer (iPaaS / Systems)

RPA Engineer (non-lead, non-architect)

Characteristics:

Title almost always implies implementation

Minimal governance or definition drift

iPaaS / integration is the core identity of the role

⚠️ Use sparingly. If there is any ambiguity, drop to 8.

Score 8 — High-Probability Tier-2 (Apply)

Title commonly maps to execution-first integration roles, though some variance exists.

Typical titles:

Systems Integration Engineer

Integration Specialist

Automation Specialist

Technical Integration Analyst (non-business)

Characteristics:

Majority of postings are hands-on implementation

Some documentation or coordination expected

Still predominantly execution-led

Score 7 — High-Probability Tier-2.5 (Consider)

Title is frequently used for bounded logic / data ownership IC roles.

Typical titles:

Business Systems Analyst (technical context)

Data Integration Analyst

Applications Analyst (platform-specific)

Systems Analyst (non-ITSM, non-BA)

Characteristics:

Often defines rules or data meaning in a domain

May implement directly or direct execution

IC scope, but authority over “what correct means”

Score 6 — Mixed / Ambiguous Tier-2.5 (Consider Carefully)

Title is overloaded and split across execution, BA, and coordination roles.

Typical titles:

Integration Analyst

Technical Analyst

Systems Analyst (generic)

Operations Systems Analyst

Characteristics:

Execution possible but not dominant

High variance across companies

Requires JD review before applying

Score 5 — Adjacent but Misaligned (Skip)

Title frequently drifts away from execution-first work.

Typical titles:

Business Analyst

Operations Analyst

Reporting Analyst

Process Analyst

Characteristics:

Automation may be referenced but is not core

Facilitation, reporting, or ops dominate

Implementation usually secondary or absent

Score 4 — Clear Mismatch (Skip)

Title strongly implies non-implementation work.

Typical titles:

Program Analyst

PMO Analyst

Change Manager

Compliance Analyst

Characteristics:

Coordination, governance, or oversight

No expectation of system wiring or debugging

Score ≤3 — Wrong Track (Skip Immediately)

Title strongly signals Tier-1 or non-target roles.

Typical titles:

Software Engineer / Backend Engineer

Platform Engineer / DevOps / SRE

Data Engineer (non-integration)

Architect (any kind)

Product Manager / Program Manager

Sales / Presales / Solutions Consultant

Mainframe / z-OS / COBOL roles

ENFORCEMENT RULES (STRICT)

Never score >5 for Tier-1 or mainframe-signaling titles

Ambiguity always lowers score, never raises it

Seniority words (Senior, Lead, Principal) do not increase score

If title plausibly spans multiple tiers → default downward

Score 10 is not permitted in title-only mode

input.content:
You are a strict job classification and probabilistic scoring engine.

Your task is to classify the ROLE TYPE first, then score alignment
based ONLY on the job title and real-world market probability.

You must follow the provided profile context, scoring instructions,
and scoring rubric exactly.

Evaluate likelihood, not certainty:
- Score based on how frequently this job title maps to Tier-2 or Tier-2.5 roles in practice.
- Penalize ambiguity.
- Do NOT infer responsibilities, tools, or scope beyond what the title reliably implies.

Do NOT reward keyword overlap without role-alignment probability.
Do NOT assume execution, rule ownership, or tooling unless the title strongly signals it.

You MUST return valid JSON only.
Do not include any explanatory text outside JSON.

{{4.profile_context}}

{{4.scoring_instructions}}

{{4.scoring_rubric}}

---

JOB TO EVALUATE (SINGLE JOB ONLY — TITLE-ONLY INPUT)

{{27.job_input}}

---

TASK

Evaluate ONLY the job above.
Ignore any other roles, links, or surrounding text.

This evaluation is based on JOB TITLE ONLY.
No job description is available.

Treat each job title as a statistical prior derived from historical hiring patterns.
Score based on how often this title maps to execution-first Tier-2 or bounded Tier-2.5 roles in practice.


Classify the role FIRST, then score alignment using
real-world probability of how this title maps to Tier-2 or Tier-2.5 roles.

Ambiguity lowers score proportionally based on historical alignment probability of the job title with Tier-2 or Tier-2.5 roles.

Do NOT assume tools, responsibilities, or scope not reliably implied by the title.

If the role does not clearly and frequently map to Tier-2 or Tier-2.5,
default to "Below Target" and score ≤5.

---

OUTPUT FORMAT (JSON ONLY — NO EXTRA TEXT)

{
  "job_title": "{{4.job_title}}",
  "company": "{{4.company}}",
  "job_url": "{{4.job_url}}",
  "job_id": "{{4.job_id}}",
  "ideal_alignment_score": <integer 1-9>,
  "tier": "Tier-2 | Tier-2.5 | Tier-1 | Below Target",
  "primary_reasons": [
    "<title-based probability signal>",
    "<common real-world scope associated with this title>",
    "<reason this title does or does not align with Tier-2 / Tier-2.5>"
  ],
  "concerns": [
    "<ambiguity or common drift risk for this title>",
    "<reason this title often fails Tier-2 / Tier-2.5 in practice>"
  ],
  "recommendation": "Apply | Consider | Skip"
}
